page.title: 03Uyeasound Up Helly Aa Galley
page.content: At the 1984 Up Helly Aa,the galley was unusually burned instead of just having a bonfire,as the galley was 22 years old and in need of replacement. The new galley was built from donated timber and plywood,by voluntary labour in Uyeasound.It was built in a shed on the Westside of Uyeasound.It is hoped that a shed will be built to house the galley so that she will last even longer than the last one.This shed can also be used for making the Up Helly Aa torches. The new galley is called Thiki.The 1985 Guizer Jarl got this name from an old friend who told him it was the name of a young Norwegian maiden who waited on the shore for the Norsemen returning from a raid.
